void TM_ChannelConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_CH_Enum  Channel,
TM_CHCTL_Enum  Control 
)

Enable or Disable the TMx channel N.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Channel,:Specify the TM channel. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CH_0 : TM channel 0
  • TM_CH_1 : TM channel 1
  • TM_CH_2 : TM channel 2
  • TM_CH_3 : TM channel 3
  • TM_CH_4 : TM channel 4
  • TM_CH_5 : TM channel 5
  • TM_CH_6 : TM channel 6
  • TM_CH_7 : TM channel 7
Control,:This parameter can be TM_CHCTL_ENABLE or TM_CHCTL_DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 880 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_ChExternalClockConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_TRSEL_Enum  Sel,
TM_CHP_Enum  Pol,
u8  Filter 
)

Configure external clock mode of the TMx. Used CHx as the clock source.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Sel,:Specify the channel source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_TRSEL_TI0BED : TI0 both edge detector
  • TM_TRSEL_TI0S0 : Filtered timer input 0
  • TM_TRSEL_TI1S1 : Filtered timer input 1
Pol,:Specify the CHx Polarity. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CHP_NONINVERTED : active high.
  • TM_CHP_INVERTED : active low.
Filter,:Specify the filter value. This parameter must be a value between 0x0 and 0xF.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 556 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

TM_CH_Enum  Channel,
TM_CHP_Enum  Pol

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.

  • TM_CH_4 : TM channel 4
  • TM_CH_5 : TM channel 5
  • TM_CH_6 : TM channel 6
  • TM_CH_7 : TM channel 7
Pol,:Specify the polarity of channel N. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CHP_NONINVERTED : active high
  • TM_CHP_INVERTED : active low

Definition at line 957 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_CHPSCConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_CH_Enum  Channel,
TM_CHPSC_Enum  Psc 
)

Configure input capture prescaler.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Channel,:Specify the TM channel. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CH_0 : TM channel 0
  • TM_CH_1 : TM channel 1
  • TM_CH_2 : TM channel 2
  • TM_CH_3 : TM channel 3
Psc,:Specify the input capture prescaler new value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CHPSC_OFF : No prescaler
  • TM_CHPSC_2 : Capture is done once every 2 events
  • TM_CHPSC_4 : Capture is done once every 4 events
  • TM_CHPSC_8 : Capture is done once every 8 events
Return values:
None

Definition at line 1379 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_CKDIVConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_CKDIV_Enum  Div 
)

Set clock division value of the TMx.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Div,:Specify the clock division value. This parameter can be one of the following value:
  • TM_CKDIV_OFF : fDTS = fCLKIN
  • TM_CKDIV_2 : fDTS = fCLKIN / 2
  • TM_CKDIV_4 : fDTS = fCLKIN / 4
  • TM_CKDIV_8 : fDTS = fCLKIN / 8
Return values:
None

Definition at line 1406 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_ClearFlag ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
u32  TM_FLAG 
)

Clear flags of the TMx.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
TM_FLAG,:Specify the flag to be cleared. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • TM_FLAG_CH0CC : TM Capture/compare 0 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH1CC : TM Capture/compare 1 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH2CC : TM Capture/compare 2 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH3CC : TM Capture/compare 3 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH4CC : TM Compare 4 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH5CC : TM Compare 5 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH6CC : TM Compare 6 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH7CC : TM Compare 7 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH0OC : TM channel 0 overcapture flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH1OC : TM channel 1 overcapture flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH2OC : TM channel 2 overcapture flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH3OC : TM channel 3 overcapture flag
  • TM_FLAG_UEV : TM update flag
  • TM_FLAG_UEV2 : TM update 2 flag
  • TM_FLAG_TEV : TM trigger flag
  • TM_FLAG_BRK0 : TM break 0 flag
  • TM_FLAG_BRK1 : TM break 1 flag
Return values:
None

Definition at line 1570 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_ClearIntPendingBit ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
u32  TM_INT 
)

Clear interrupt pending bits of the TMx.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
TM_INT,:Specify the TM interrupt to be cleared. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • TM_INT_CH0CC : TM Capture/compare 0 interrupt
  • TM_INT_CH1CC : TM Capture/compare 1 interrupt
  • TM_INT_CH2CC : TM Capture/compare 2 interrupt
  • TM_INT_CH3CC : TM Capture/compare 3 interrupt
  • TM_INT_CH4CC : TM Compare 4 interrupt
  • TM_INT_CH5CC : TM Compare 5 interrupt
  • TM_INT_CH6CC : TM Compare 6 interrupt
  • TM_INT_CH7CC : TM Compare 7 interrupt
  • TM_INT_UEV : TM update interrupt
  • TM_INT_UEV2 : TM update 2 interrupt
  • TM_INT_TEV : TM trigger interrupt
  • TM_INT_BRKEV : TM break interrupt
Return values:
None

void TM_CounterModeConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_CNT_MODE_Enum  Mod 
)

Configure counter mode of the TMx.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Mod,:Specify the counter mode to be used. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CNT_MODE_UP : TM up counting mode.
  • TM_CNT_MODE_DOWN : TM down counting mode.
  • TM_CNT_MODE_CA1 : TM center aligned mode 1.
  • TM_CNT_MODE_CA2 : TM center aligned mode 2.
  • TM_CNT_MODE_CA3 : TM center aligned mode 3.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 846 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_DecoderConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_SMSEL_Enum  DecoderMod,
TM_CHP_Enum  CH0P,
TM_CHP_Enum  CH1P 
)

Configure encoder interface of the TMx.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
DecoderMod,:Specify the TMx decoder mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_SMSEL_DECODER1 : Counter counts on CH0 edge depending on CH1 level.
  • TM_SMSEL_DECODER2 : Counter counts on CH1 edge depending on CH0 level.
  • TM_SMSEL_DECODER3 : Counter counts on both CH0 and CH1 edges depending on the level of the other input.
CH0P,:Specify the CH0 polarity. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CHP_NONINVERTED : Active high level or rising edge
  • TM_CHP_INVERTED : Active low level or falling edge
CH1P,:Specify the CH1 polarity. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CHP_NONINVERTED : Active high level or rising edge
  • TM_CHP_INVERTED : Active low level or falling edge
Return values:
None

Definition at line 757 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 104 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_ForcedOREF ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_CH_Enum  TM_CH_n,
TM_OM_Enum  ForcedAction 
)

Force the TMx CHnOREF waveform to active or inactive level.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
TM_CH_n,:Specify the TM channel. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CH_0 : TM channel 0
  • TM_CH_1 : TM channel 1
  • TM_CH_2 : TM channel 2
  • TM_CH_3 : TM channel 3
  • TM_CH_4 : TM channel 4
  • TM_CH_5 : TM channel 5
  • TM_CH_6 : TM channel 6
  • TM_CH_7 : TM channel 7
ForcedAction,:Specify the forced action to be set to the output waveform. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_OM_FORCED_ACTIVE : Forced active level on CH0OREF
  • TM_OM_FORCED_INACTIVE : Forced inactive level on CH0OREF.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 821 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_GenerateEvent ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
u32  TM_EVENT 
)

Generate TMx events.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
TM_EVENT,:Stores the event source. This parameter can be any combination of following:
  • TM_EVENT_CH0CC : Timer Capture/compare 0 event
  • TM_EVENT_CH1CC : Timer Capture/compare 1 event
  • TM_EVENT_CH2CC : Timer Capture/compare 2 event
  • TM_EVENT_CH3CC : Timer Capture/compare 3 event
  • TM_EVENT_CH4CC : Timer Compare 4 event
  • TM_EVENT_CH5CC : Timer Compare 5 event
  • TM_EVENT_CH6CC : Timer Compare 6 event
  • TM_EVENT_CH7CC : Timer Compare 7 event
  • TM_EVENT_UEV : Timer update event
  • TM_EVENT_UEV2 : Timer update event 2
  • TM_EVENT_TEV : Timer trigger event
  • TM_EVENT_BRKEV : Timer break event
Return values:
None

TM_CH_Enum  TM_CH_n 
)

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.

  • TM_CH_0 : TM channel 0
  • TM_CH_1 : TM channel 1
  • TM_CH_2 : TM channel 2
  • TM_CH_3 : TM channel 3

u32  TM_FLAG 
)

Check whether the specified TMx flag has been set.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
TM_FLAG,:Specify the flag to be checked. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_FLAG_CH0CC : TM Capture/compare 0 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH1CC : TM Capture/compare 1 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH2CC : TM Capture/compare 2 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH3CC : TM Capture/compare 3 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH4CC : TM Compare 4 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH5CC : TM Compare 5 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH6CC : TM Compare 6 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH7CC : TM Compare 7 flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH0OC : TM channel 0 overcapture flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH1OC : TM channel 1 overcapture flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH2OC : TM channel 2 overcapture flag
  • TM_FLAG_CH3OC : TM channel 3 overcapture flag
  • TM_FLAG_UEV : TM update flag
  • TM_FLAG_UEV2 : TM update 2 flag
  • TM_FLAG_TEV : TM trigger flag
  • TM_FLAG_BRK0 : TM break 0 flag
  • TM_FLAG_BRK1 : TM break 1 flag
Return values:
Thenew state of TM_FLAG (SET or RESET).

Definition at line 526 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_MMSELConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_MMSEL_Enum  Sel 
)

Select master trigger output source of the TMx.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Sel,:Specify the master trigger output source. This parameter can be as follow:
  • TM_MMSEL_RESET : Send trigger signal when S/W setting UEVG or slave restart
  • TM_MMSEL_ENABLE : The counter enable signal is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_UPDATE : The update event is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH0CC : Channel 0 capture or compare match occurred as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH0OREF : The CH0OREF signal is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH1OREF : The CH1OREF signal is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH2OREF : The CH2OREF signal is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH3OREF : The CH3OREF signal is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH4OREF : The CH4OREF signal is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH5OREF : The CH5OREF signal is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH6OREF : The CH6OREF signal is used as trigger output.
  • TM_MMSEL_CH7OREF : The CH7OREF signal is used as trigger output.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 220 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_OutputModeConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_CH_Enum  Channel,
TM_OM_Enum  Mod 
)

Configure output mode of the TMx.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Channel,:Specify the TM channel. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_CH_0 : TM channel 0
  • TM_CH_1 : TM channel 1
  • TM_CH_2 : TM channel 2
  • TM_CH_3 : TM channel 3
  • TM_CH_4 : TM channel 4
  • TM_CH_5 : TM channel 5
  • TM_CH_6 : TM channel 6
  • TM_CH_7 : TM channel 7
Mod,:Specify the TM output mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • TM_OM_MATCH_NOCHANGE : Output dont change on match
  • TM_OM_MATCH_INACTIVE : Output inactive on compare match
  • TM_OM_MATCH_ACTIVE : Output active on compare match
  • TM_OM_MATCH_TOGGLE : Output toggle on compare match
  • TM_OM_FORCED_INACTIVE : Output forced inactive
  • TM_OM_FORCED_ACTIVE : Output forced active
  • TM_OM_PWM1 : PWM1 mode
  • TM_OM_PWM2 : PWM2 mode
  • TM_OM_ASYMMETRIC_PWM1 : Asymmetric PWM1 mode
  • TM_OM_ASYMMETRIC_PWM2 : Asymmetric PWM2 mode
Return values:
None
Note:
This function disables the selected channel before changing the output mode.

Definition at line 1241 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_StiConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
TM_TRSEL_Enum  Sel 
)

Select the STI source.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
Sel,:Specify the STI source. This parameter can be one of the following:
  • TM_TRSEL_ITI0 : Internal trigger 0.
  • TM_TRSEL_ITI1 : Internal trigger 1.
  • TM_TRSEL_ITI2 : Internal trigger 2.
  • TM_TRSEL_TI0BED : TI0 both edge detector.
  • TM_TRSEL_TI0S0 : Filtered channel 0 input.
  • TM_TRSEL_TI1S1 : Filtered channel 1 input.
  • TM_TRSEL_ETIF : External trigger input.
  • TM_TRSEL_UEVG : Trigger by setting UEVG bit.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 1257 of file ht32f5xxxx_tm.c.

void TM_UEVG_IntConfig ( HT_TM_TypeDef *  TMx,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Configure UEVG interrupt function of the TMx.

Parameters:
TMx,:where TMx is the selected TM from the TM peripherals.
NewState,:This parameter can be one of the following value:
  • ENABLE : Default value. Any of the following events will generate an update event interrupt:
    • Counter overflow/underflow
    • Setting the UEVG bit
    • Update generation through the slave restart mode
  • DISABLE : Only counter overflow/underflow generations an update event interrupt.
Return values:
None
